discussion.content: set-mailbox HRService -ThrottlingPolicy HR is also correct. I can use this to assign a throttlingPolicy.
Note, the Set-ThrottlingPolicyAssociation command should be HRService not HR. HRService is the identity to increase the throttling to using a policy HR.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Your company has 5,000 Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 mailboxes.
The company is implementing a new application named HR1 that integrates with Exchange. HR1 runs on a server named HRSERVER.
You create a new mailbox named HRService for the service account of HR1.
You need to ensure that HR1 can sync contacts from all the mailboxes in the Exchange organization concurrently by using an Exchange ActiveSync connection.
How should you complete the PowerShell script? To answer, drag the appropriate values to the correct targets. Each value may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: B. Move TransportPF to a public folder mailbox hosted in the BRANCH office.

comments.content: I had the same question. It doesn't make sense. For me the correct Answer lies closer to D. Adding Public folder as Favorite (using option Download Public Folder Favorites) makes a difference in Cached Exchange Mode. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/download-public-folders-in-cached-exchange-mode-39807488-8098-4a9c-b246-4c25e3e20510

discussion.content:
How is B the correct answer? The Network infrastructure already states "Public folders are hosted only on an Exchange server in the main office"
Isn't moving it to the main office redundant since it's already there?

questions.question_text:
You need to resolve the issue for the transport department users.
What is the best way to achieve the goal? More than one answer choice may achieve the goal. Select the BEST answer.

choices.B: Move TransportPF to a public folder mailbox hosted in the main office.
choices.D: Instruct the transport department users to add TransportPF to their Favorites list in Outlook.
choices.A: Move the public folder mailbox that contains TransportPF to a server in the main office.
choices.C: Modify the default public folder mailbox for all the transport department users.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to configure the environment to support the planned changes for email addresses.
How should you complete the command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:

comments.content: Ellichen is correct. %s%2g@contoso.com...%s will cover all the letters in last(sur) name and %2g will cover the 2 chars in First (given) name

discussion.content:
Since the answers are missing:
- Set-Mailbox -Name 'User Mailboxes' -RecipientFilter {(RecipientType -eq ' UserMailbox')} -EnabledEmailAddressTemplate 'SMTP.%2d%2g@contoso.com'

questions.question_text:
You need to configure the Exchange organization to meet the security requirements for sending email messages to distribution groups.
Which cmdlet should you run?

HOTSPOT -
Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that complete each statement based on the information presented in the Exchange Online Connector exhibit.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answer should be 
Sender Domains 
To the Edge server encrypted (given answer doesnt makes sense)

From question: All email messages sent to contoso.com are delivered to Exchange Online. All messages sent to on-premises mailboxes are routed through the Edge Transport server. All email messages sent from an SMTP domain named fabrikam.com to contoso.com must be encrypted.
SenderDomains TLS configuration ensures TLS is enforced.
There will be NDR because the TLS may not be enforced at the on-prem exchange.
https://ironcovesolutions.com/blog/how-to-force-tls-on-office-365 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/transport-routing#route-incoming-internet-messages-through-your-on-premises-organization
